region of New South Wales, Australia.
Bowral is accessible by car via the

. It is about 136 km south-west from the Sydney CBD. It takes about 80 minutes to get to Bowral from Sydney which makes it an ideal location for Sydneysider weekenders and daytrippers.  
The town is accessible from the nearby town of
road due south as well as

in Sydney every 40-60 minutes on a weekday and every 1-2 hours on a weekend.  Services after certain late night hours and days trains are not in use until earlier the next morning so it would be smart to grab a train timetable and plan ahead.
is the prime bus company of the Southern Highlands only does services to and from Bowral to

which is an airport shuttle service which goes to all the terminals of
from and to Bowral. The bus charter is only three times a day and on the weekend only once depending on the bookings. This service must be booked and services can go to
runs a coach service from Parramatta, Liverpool and Campbelltown to Bowral six days a week. This service then travels onto Kangaroo Valley, Nowra and the South Coast as far as Narooma.'''
and its surrounding streets) has boutiques, caf√©s and attractions such as the

which are all within walking distance of each other. However, attractions like the golf clubs, cellar doors and wineries, manor houses and other attractions are short driving distances around Bowral which would either require a car or taxi.

Taxis are available 24 hours a day on

. They are stationed at the taxi bay which is in the middle of Bong Bong St during the day and at night can be summonded via a taxi phone near the bay. Meter rates are almost double the city rate, however, like most taxi services concessions are accepted if you are a pensioner. 

Driving your own form of transport is recommended because like all rural areas Bowral itself is just one attraction of many attractions that make up the Southern Highlands like
which are not accessible by public transport but by driving.

value: content=An easy walking tour through Bowral to see the childhood homes of Sir Donald Bradman, his school, and his church. Finish the morning at the Bradman Museum for lunch at Stumps Tea Shop.
price=$5/30 min (Wi-Fi currently free for any visitors)
content=NSW library card holders get free PC/internet use. Ask at desk for Wi-Fi password. 1 hour maximum.
directions=located inside Video Ezy store, enter from rear car park
